name: Maximise security through Pod Security Policies
description:
As a Cloud Security Adminministrator
I want to ensure that a stringent set of Pod Security Policies are present
So that a policy of least privilege can be enforced in order to prevent malicious attacks on my organization

comments.value: #Rule: Insert tags here. ... for some reason 'Rule:' doesn't work in latest godog ..
#TODO: for 5.2.1 .. these are all 'creation', so 'deployment running' should be changed to 'deployment created'
#TODO: question .. how specific should we be on the control terminology?  e.g. should we stick with
# the below, or specific, like "And 'isPrivileged' is set to <true|false>"??
#TODO: also ... for 5.2.5, we can test to prevent creation, but what about trying to execute a cmd which reqs root?
# think we should do that, but is that a separate scenario or blend into this one?  for some this makes sense - mark with @detective?

elements.name: Prevent a deployment from running with privileged access

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent a Kubernetes deployment running with privileged access in an existing Kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
privileged access request is marked "True" for the Kubernetes deployment
the operation will "Fail" with an error "Containers with privileged access can’t run"
I should not be able to perform a command that requires privileged access
I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent a deployment from running with privileged access

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent a Kubernetes deployment running with privileged access in an existing Kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
privileged access request is marked "False" for the Kubernetes deployment
the operation will "Succeed" with an error "No error would show"
I should not be able to perform a command that requires privileged access
I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent a deployment from running with privileged access

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent a Kubernetes deployment running with privileged access in an existing Kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
privileged access request is marked "Not Defined" for the Kubernetes deployment
the operation will "Succeed" with an error "No error would show"
I should not be able to perform a command that requires privileged access
I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent a deployment from running with the hostPID

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent a Kubernetes deployment from running using the hostPID in an existing Kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
hostPID request is marked "True" for the Kubernetes deployment
the operation will "Fail" with an error "Containers cant run using hostPID"
I should not be able to perform a command that provides access to the host PID namespace
I should be able to perform an allowed command

I should not be able to perform a command that provides access to the host PID namespace
I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent a deployment from running as the root user

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent a Kubernetes deployment from running as the root user in an existing Kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
the user requested is "Root" for the Kubernetes deployment
the operation will "Fail" with an error "Containers cant run as root"
the Kubernetes deployment should run with a non-root UID
I should be able to perform an allowed command

the operation will "Succeed" with an error ""
the Kubernetes deployment should run with a non-root UID
I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent deployments from running with the NET_RAW capability.

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent a Kubernetes deployment from running with NET_RAW capability in an existing Kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
NET_RAW is marked "True" for the Kubernetes deployment
the operation will "Fail" with an error "Containers cant run with NET_RAW capabilities"
I should not be able to perform a command that requires NET_RAW capability
I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent container running with capabilities beyond the default set.

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent Kubernetes deployments with capabilities beyond the default set from being deployed to an existing kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
additional capabilities "ARE" requested for the Kubernetes deployment

result.error_message: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference

steps.name: the operation will "Fail" with an error "Containers can't run with added capabilities"
I should not be able to perform a command that requires capabilities outside of the default set
I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent container running with capabilities beyond the default set.

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent Kubernetes deployments with capabilities beyond the default set from being deployed to an existing kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
additional capabilities "ARE NOT" requested for the Kubernetes deployment

result.error_message: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference

steps.name: the operation will "Succeed" with an error ""
I should not be able to perform a command that requires capabilities outside of the default set
I should be able to perform an allowed command

I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent deployments from accessing unapproved port range

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent Kubernetes deployments with unapproved port range from being deployed to an existing Kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
an "unapproved" port range is requested for the Kubernetes deployment

result.error_message: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference

steps.name: the operation will "Fail" with an error "Cannot access unapproved port range"
I should not be able to perform a command that access an unapproved port range
I should be able to perform an allowed command

I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent deployments from running without approved seccomp profile

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent Kubernetes deployments without approved seccomp profiles from being deployed to an existing Kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
an "unapproved" seccomp profile is requested for the Kubernetes deployment
the operation will "Fail" with an error "Cannot request unapproved seccomp profile"
I should not be able to perform a system call that is blocked by the seccomp profile
I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent deployments from running without approved seccomp profile

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent Kubernetes deployments without approved seccomp profiles from being deployed to an existing Kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
an "approved" seccomp profile is requested for the Kubernetes deployment
the operation will "Succeed" with an error "no error"
I should not be able to perform a system call that is blocked by the seccomp profile
I should be able to perform an allowed command

elements.name: Prevent deployments from running without approved seccomp profile

steps.name: a Kubernetes cluster exists which we can deploy into
some system exists to prevent Kubernetes deployments without approved seccomp profiles from being deployed to an existing Kubernetes cluster
a Kubernetes deployment is applied to an existing Kubernetes cluster
an "undefined" seccomp profile is requested for the Kubernetes deployment
the operation will "Fail" with an error "Approved seccomp profile required"
I should not be able to perform a system call that is blocked by the seccomp profile
I should be able to perform an allowed command
